comments:
In a java project which has the SWT library added, select File - New - Visual 
Class.
On the New Java Visual Class dialog, select the SWT style 'Composite' 
(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite), and select finish.
This throws the following exception...

And it pops the following error into the problems view...
Severity	Description	Resource	In Folder	Location
	Creation Time
2	Implicit super constructor Composite() is not visible for default 
constructor. Must define an explicit constructor	Z02.java
	jp02/pak01	line 17	15 July 2004 14:23:10

This needs to be fixed in order to support the capability to extend Composite in
the VE. Not sure what has to be done here.
*** Bug 70317 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

WE are not going to have composite for M2, but we will need to support this.
This will require work for Edit Parts and Code Gen to support the instantiation
of a composite with a pseudo parent.

Design for supporting Composite in the VE is in bug 71854

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 71854 ***
